[1;34malign: Whether the object should be aligned with the start, end or[0m [1;34m center of its container. If set as a tuple it will declare[0m [1;34m (vertical, horizontal) alignment.[0m [1;31maspect_ratio: Describes the proportional relationship between component‚Äôs[0m [1;31m width and height. Otherwise, if[0m [1;31m set to "auto", component‚Äôs preferred width and height will[0m [1;31m be used to determine the aspect (if not set, no aspect will be[0m [1;31m preserved).[0m [1;34mbackground: Background color of the component.[0m [1;31mcss_classes: CSS classes to apply to the overall Card.[0m [1;34mdesign: The design system to use to style components.[0m [1;31mheight: The height of the component (in pixels). May[0m [1;34m be specified as a two-tuple of the form (vertical, horizontal)[0m [1;34m or a four-tuple (top, right, bottom, left).[0m [1;31mstyles: Dictionary of CSS rules to apply to DOM node wrapping the[0m [1;31m component.[0m [1;34mstylesheets: List of stylesheets defined as URLs pointing to .css files[0m [1;34m or raw CSS defined as a string.[0m [1;31mtags: List of arbitrary tags to add to the component.[0m [1;31m Can be useful for templating or for storing metadata on[0m [1;31m the model.[0m [1;34mwidth: The width of the component (in pixels). This can be either[0m [1;34m fixed or preferred width, depending on width sizing policy.[0m [1;31mwidth_policy: Describes how the component should maintain its width.[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m "auto"``[0m [1;31m                              Use component's preferred sizing policy.[0m [1;31m                          [0m [1;31m                          ``"fixed"``[0m [1;31m                              Use exactly ``width pixels. Component will overflow if[0m [1;31m it can‚Äôt fit in the available horizontal space.[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m "fit"``[0m [1;31m                              Use component's preferred width (if set) and allow it to[0m [1;31m                              fit into the available horizontal space within the minimum[0m [1;31m                              and maximum width bounds (if set). Component's width[0m [1;31m                              neither will be aggressively minimized nor maximized.[0m [1;31m                          [0m [1;31m                          ``"min"``[0m [1;31m                              Use as little horizontal space as possible, not less than[0m [1;31m                              the minimum width (if set).  The starting point is the[0m [1;31m                              preferred width (if set). The width of the component may[0m [1;31m                              shrink or grow depending on the parent layout, aspect[0m [1;31m                              management and other factors.[0m [1;31m                          [0m [1;31m                          ``"max"``[0m [1;31m                              Use as much horizontal space as possible, not more than[0m [1;31m                              the maximum width (if set).  The starting point is the[0m [1;31m                              preferred width (if set). The width of the component may[0m [1;31m                              shrink or grow depending on the parent layout, aspect[0m [1;31m                              management and other factors.[0m [1;34mheight_policy:            Describes how the component should maintain its height.[0m [1;34m                          [0m [1;34m                          ``"auto"``[0m [1;34m                              Use component's preferred sizing policy.[0m [1;34m                          [0m [1;34m                          ``"fixed"``[0m [1;34m                              Use exactly ``height pixels. Component will overflow if[0m [1;34m it can‚Äôt fit in the available vertical space.[0m [1;34m [0m [1;34m "fit"``[0m [1;34m                              Use component's preferred height (if set) and allow to fit[0m [1;34m                              into the available vertical space within the minimum and[0m [1;34m                              maximum height bounds (if set). Component's height neither[0m [1;34m                              will be aggressively minimized nor maximized.[0m [1;34m                          [0m [1;34m                          ``"min"``[0m [1;34m                              Use as little vertical space as possible, not less than[0m [1;34m                              the minimum height (if set).  The starting point is the[0m [1;34m                              preferred height (if set). The height of the component may[0m [1;34m                              shrink or grow depending on the parent layout, aspect[0m [1;34m                              management and other factors.[0m [1;34m                          [0m [1;34m                          ``"max"``[0m [1;34m                              Use as much vertical space as possible, not more than the[0m [1;34m                              maximum height (if set).  The starting point is the[0m [1;34m                              preferred height (if set). The height of the component may[0m [1;34m                              shrink or grow depending on the parent layout, aspect[0m [1;34m                              management and other factors.[0m [1;31msizing_mode:              How the component should size itself.[0m [1;31m                          [0m [1;31m                          This is a high-level setting for maintaining width and height[0m [1;31m                          of the component. To gain more fine grained control over[0m [1;31m                          sizing, use ``width_policy, height_policy and[0m [1;31m aspect_ratio instead (those take precedence over[0m [1;31m sizing_mode).[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m ``‚Äùfixed‚Äù``[0m [1;31m Component is not responsive. It will retain its original[0m [1;31m width and height regardless of any subsequent browser[0m [1;31m window resize events.[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m ``‚Äùstretch_width‚Äù``[0m [1;31m Component will responsively resize to stretch to the[0m [1;31m available width, without maintaining any aspect ratio. The[0m [1;31m height of the component depends on the type of the[0m [1;31m component and may be fixed or fit to component‚Äôs contents.[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m ``‚Äùstretch_height‚Äù``[0m [1;31m Component will responsively resize to stretch to the[0m [1;31m available height, without maintaining any aspect[0m [1;31m ratio. The width of the component depends on the type of[0m [1;31m the component and may be fixed or fit to component‚Äôs[0m [1;31m contents.[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m ``‚Äùstretch_both‚Äù``[0m [1;31m Component is completely responsive, independently in width[0m [1;31m and height, and will occupy all the available horizontal[0m [1;31m and vertical space, even if this changes the aspect ratio[0m [1;31m of the component.[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m ``‚Äùscale_width‚Äù``[0m [1;31m Component will responsively resize to stretch to the[0m [1;31m available width, while maintaining the original or[0m [1;31m provided aspect ratio.[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m ``‚Äùscale_height‚Äù``[0m [1;31m Component will responsively resize to stretch to the[0m [1;31m available height, while maintaining the original or[0m [1;31m provided aspect ratio.[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m ``‚Äùscale_both‚Äù``[0m [1;31m Component will responsively resize to both the available[0m [1;31m width and height, while maintaining the original or[0m [1;31m provided aspect ratio.[0m [1;34mvisible: Whether the component is visible. Setting visible to false will[0m [1;34m hide the component entirely.[0m [1;31mloading: Whether or not the Viewable is loading. If True a loading spinner[0m [1;31m is shown on top of the Viewable.[0m [1;34mobjects: The list of child objects that make up the layout.[0m [1;31mscroll: Whether to add scrollbars if the content overflows the size[0m [1;31m of the container.[0m [1;34mactive_header_background: A valid CSS color for the header background when not collapsed.[0m [1;31mbutton_css_classes: CSS classes to apply to the button element.[0m [1;34mcollapsible: Whether the Card should be expandable and collapsible.[0m [1;31mcollapsed: Whether the contents of the Card are collapsed.[0m [1;34mheader: A Panel component to display in the header bar of the Card.[0m [1;34m Will override the given title if defined.[0m [1;31mheader_background: A valid CSS color for the header background.[0m [1;34mheader_color: A valid CSS color to apply to the header text.[0m [1;31mheader_css_classes: CSS classes to apply to the header element.[0m [1;34mhide_header: Whether to skip rendering the header.[0m [1;31mtitle_css_classes: CSS classes to apply to the header title.[0m [1;34mtitle: A title to be displayed in the Card header, will be overridden[0m [1;34m by the header if defined.[0m

[1;32mParameter docstrings: =====================[0m

[1;34mdisplay_threshold: Parameters with precedence below this value are not displayed.[0m [1;31mdefault_precedence: Precedence value to use for parameters with no declared[0m [1;31m precedence. By default, zero predecence is available for[0m [1;31m forcing some parameters to the top of the list, and other[0m [1;31m values above the default_precedence values can be used to sort[0m [1;31m or group parameters arbitrarily.[0m [1;34malign: Whether the object should be aligned with the start, end or[0m [1;34m center of its container. If set as a tuple it will declare[0m [1;34m (vertical, horizontal) alignment.[0m [1;31maspect_ratio: Describes the proportional relationship between component‚Äôs[0m [1;31m width and height. This works if any of component‚Äôs dimensions[0m [1;31m are flexible in size. If set to a number, width / height =[0m [1;31m                    aspect_ratio relationship will be maintained. Otherwise, if[0m [1;31m set to "auto", component‚Äôs preferred width and height will[0m [1;31m be used to determine the aspect (if not set, no aspect will be[0m [1;31m preserved).[0m [1;34mbackground: Background color of the component.[0m [1;31mcss_classes: CSS classes to apply to the layout.[0m [1;34mdesign: The design system to use to style components.[0m [1;31mheight: Height of widgetbox the parameter widgets are displayed in.[0m [1;34mmin_width: Minimal width of the component (in pixels) if width is adjustable.[0m [1;31mmin_height: Minimal height of the component (in pixels) if height is adjustable.[0m [1;34mmax_width: Minimal width of the component (in pixels) if width is adjustable.[0m [1;31mmax_height: Minimal height of the component (in pixels) if height is adjustable.[0m [1;34mmargin: Allows to create additional space around the component. May[0m [1;34m be specified as a two-tuple of the form (vertical, horizontal)[0m [1;34m or a four-tuple (top, right, bottom, left).[0m [1;31mstyles: Dictionary of CSS rules to apply to DOM node wrapping the[0m [1;31m component.[0m [1;34mstylesheets: List of stylesheets defined as URLs pointing to .css files[0m [1;34m or raw CSS defined as a string.[0m [1;31mtags: List of arbitrary tags to add to the component.[0m [1;31m Can be useful for templating or for storing metadata on[0m [1;31m the model.[0m [1;34mwidth: Width of widgetbox the parameter widgets are displayed in.[0m [1;31mwidth_policy: Describes how the component should maintain its width.[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m "auto"``[0m [1;31m                        Use component's preferred sizing policy.[0m [1;31m                    [0m [1;31m                    ``"fixed"``[0m [1;31m                        Use exactly ``width pixels. Component will overflow if[0m [1;31m it can‚Äôt fit in the available horizontal space.[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m "fit"``[0m [1;31m                        Use component's preferred width (if set) and allow it to[0m [1;31m                        fit into the available horizontal space within the minimum[0m [1;31m                        and maximum width bounds (if set). Component's width[0m [1;31m                        neither will be aggressively minimized nor maximized.[0m [1;31m                    [0m [1;31m                    ``"min"``[0m [1;31m                        Use as little horizontal space as possible, not less than[0m [1;31m                        the minimum width (if set).  The starting point is the[0m [1;31m                        preferred width (if set). The width of the component may[0m [1;31m                        shrink or grow depending on the parent layout, aspect[0m [1;31m                        management and other factors.[0m [1;31m                    [0m [1;31m                    ``"max"``[0m [1;31m                        Use as much horizontal space as possible, not more than[0m [1;31m                        the maximum width (if set).  The starting point is the[0m [1;31m                        preferred width (if set). The width of the component may[0m [1;31m                        shrink or grow depending on the parent layout, aspect[0m [1;31m                        management and other factors.[0m [1;34mheight_policy:      Describes how the component should maintain its height.[0m [1;34m                    [0m [1;34m                    ``"auto"``[0m [1;34m                        Use component's preferred sizing policy.[0m [1;34m                    [0m [1;34m                    ``"fixed"``[0m [1;34m                        Use exactly ``height pixels. Component will overflow if[0m [1;34m it can‚Äôt fit in the available vertical space.[0m [1;34m [0m [1;34m "fit"``[0m [1;34m                        Use component's preferred height (if set) and allow to fit[0m [1;34m                        into the available vertical space within the minimum and[0m [1;34m                        maximum height bounds (if set). Component's height neither[0m [1;34m                        will be aggressively minimized nor maximized.[0m [1;34m                    [0m [1;34m                    ``"min"``[0m [1;34m                        Use as little vertical space as possible, not less than[0m [1;34m                        the minimum height (if set).  The starting point is the[0m [1;34m                        preferred height (if set). The height of the component may[0m [1;34m                        shrink or grow depending on the parent layout, aspect[0m [1;34m                        management and other factors.[0m [1;34m                    [0m [1;34m                    ``"max"``[0m [1;34m                        Use as much vertical space as possible, not more than the[0m [1;34m                        maximum height (if set).  The starting point is the[0m [1;34m                        preferred height (if set). The height of the component may[0m [1;34m                        shrink or grow depending on the parent layout, aspect[0m [1;34m                        management and other factors.[0m [1;31msizing_mode:        How the component should size itself.[0m [1;31m                    [0m [1;31m                    This is a high-level setting for maintaining width and height[0m [1;31m                    of the component. To gain more fine grained control over[0m [1;31m                    sizing, use ``width_policy, height_policy and[0m [1;31m aspect_ratio instead (those take precedence over[0m [1;31m sizing_mode).[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m ``‚Äùfixed‚Äù``[0m [1;31m Component is not responsive. It will retain its original[0m [1;31m width and height regardless of any subsequent browser[0m [1;31m window resize events.[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m ``‚Äùstretch_width‚Äù``[0m [1;31m Component will responsively resize to stretch to the[0m [1;31m available width, without maintaining any aspect ratio. The[0m [1;31m height of the component depends on the type of the[0m [1;31m component and may be fixed or fit to component‚Äôs contents.[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m ``‚Äùstretch_height‚Äù``[0m [1;31m Component will responsively resize to stretch to the[0m [1;31m available height, without maintaining any aspect[0m [1;31m ratio. The width of the component depends on the type of[0m [1;31m the component and may be fixed or fit to component‚Äôs[0m [1;31m contents.[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m ``‚Äùstretch_both‚Äù``[0m [1;31m Component is completely responsive, independently in width[0m [1;31m and height, and will occupy all the available horizontal[0m [1;31m and vertical space, even if this changes the aspect ratio[0m [1;31m of the component.[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m ``‚Äùscale_width‚Äù``[0m [1;31m Component will responsively resize to stretch to the[0m [1;31m available width, while maintaining the original or[0m [1;31m provided aspect ratio.[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m ``‚Äùscale_height‚Äù``[0m [1;31m Component will responsively resize to stretch to the[0m [1;31m available height, while maintaining the original or[0m [1;31m provided aspect ratio.[0m [1;31m [0m [1;31m ``‚Äùscale_both‚Äù``[0m [1;31m Component will responsively resize to both the available[0m [1;31m width and height, while maintaining the original or[0m [1;31m provided aspect ratio.[0m [1;34mvisible: Whether the component is visible. Setting visible to false will[0m [1;34m hide the component entirely.[0m [1;31mloading: Whether or not the Viewable is loading. If True a loading spinner[0m [1;31m is shown on top of the Viewable.[0m [1;34mdefault_layout: Defines the layout the model(s) returned by the pane will[0m [1;34m be placed in.[0m [1;31mobject: The object being wrapped, which will be converted to a[0m [1;31m Bokeh model.[0m [1;34mexpand: Whether parameterized subobjects are expanded or collapsed on[0m [1;34m instantiation.[0m [1;31mexpand_button: Whether to add buttons to expand and collapse sub-objects.[0m [1;34mexpand_layout: Layout to expand sub-objects into.[0m [1;31mhide_constant: Whether to hide widgets of constant parameters.[0m [1;34minitializer: User-supplied function that will be called on initialization,[0m [1;34m usually to update the default Parameter values of the[0m [1;34m underlying parameterized object.[0m [1;31mparameters: If set this serves as a whitelist of parameters to display on[0m [1;31m the supplied Parameterized object.[0m [1;34mshow_labels: Whether to show labels for each widget[0m [1;31mshow_name: Whether to show the parameterized object‚Äôs name[0m [1;34msort: If True the widgets will be sorted alphabetically by label.[0m [1;34m If a callable is provided it will be used to sort the Parameters,[0m [1;34m for example lambda x: x[1].label[::-1] will sort by the reversed[0m [1;34m label.[0m [1;31mwidgets: Dictionary of widget overrides, mapping from parameter name[0m [1;31m to widget class.[0m
